captions.text:
- Men who shave their faces
either go full beard or nothing,
because the stubble hurts my thighs.
(upbeat music)

- We are shaving our faces and
I'm really excited about it.
- Why are you excited?
- One, I heard it helps you apply makeup.
- I think I'm gonna do terrible.
- Many women shave their faces, okay?

There's no shame, some
of us have mustaches.
- Guys, don't even look.
- I've shaved my eyebrows before
when I couldn't get to the salon.

- Your eyebrows?
- Wow, that is an arch.
- That's precision.
- I'm really impressed that guys can do it

and not cut the crap out
of their faces everyday.

- If I don't cut myself,
then I'll be really proud.

- Cuz there's contours
that are happening here,
and I can barely do my ankles.
- So let's go do it, everyone get up,
(clapping) let's go.
- All right.
- I'm fixin' a shave my face.
- [Voiceover] Yeah.
- Whoa!
Oh my god, I don't wanna use
the ones made for women ever again.
- Karl, are you scared when you do this?
Do guys do this quickly?
Just get over here.

All right, well first of all
how much do you use, generally?
- All right, more than that.
- Whoo, it feels weird on my face.
- [Quinta] Oh my god.

- I wanna stressed that
we are shaving our faces

for the first time, but plenty
of women shave their faces.
- It smells like a boy.
I like wanna make out with myself,
I love this scent so much.
- This looks awesome.
- What a good lather Quinta.

- You just look like an
adorable santa claus.
- I messed up, it's in my nostril,
I can't breathe. (laughing)
- Go up or down, up or down?
- Okay, aah!
(whispering) Whoa!
- There is hair coming off.

- You're going so fast.
- Well isn't there pride
in the time limit?
- What do I do, I do this face, right?
(garbled speech)
- So I feel like I'm about to grow back

a full beard.
- [Becky] You're not going to.
Guys it's not gonna grow back thicker,
Google it.
- Oh, we're going into mustache territory.
(measured breathing)
- I like this part.
- [Karl] The neck is the hardest part.
- I'm not shavin' my neck.
- That hurt, that's very dangerous.
- Ooo, actually this is kind of erotic,

oh my god.
- [Voiceover] Slow down Becky.
- You're so close to your veins.

- Do you enjoy doing this,
cause this feels really good.
- I'm glad. Do I enjoy this?
Oh my god, this feels really good.
No, I hate it.

- That was scary, that was
like dangerous territory.
- Aaaaw.

- I could go toe to toe
with a baby, right now.
- Look at that lack of mustache.
- Your skin's like really shiny.
- Yeah, you look different.
- Overall, I'd say a little underwhelming.
- My face feels amazing.
It feels like so smooth.
I feel like it looks more radiant.
- I can't believe men just shave up here.

I felt like that was a little
bit too close to my eye.

- I feel like the same
girl, but a different man.
- Every time we do stuff like this,

it makes me respect men a
little bit more, not gonna lie.
Gabby's gonna hate me, but it does.
- I would for sure do this again.

The girls say it looks radiant,
Karl, say it looks radiant.
- It does feel nice afterwards.

- [Becky] Right?
- Soothing is (beep)
- It's a good way to like wake up.
I should bring a razor to work
and like do it after lunch or something.

- I'm gonna use this from
now on to shave my mustache.
- My face feels good.

- I like was really into
myself for a moment.

- I thought I was making
out with myself on my neck,
like if you don't have a man to do that,

you can just be sensual
like with yourself.
It's a little scary.
- I'm also proud that I didn't cut myself,
so hey what's up Dad? I'm an adult.
- I thought it was fantastic.
- I'm gonna go kiss some people tonight.
I'm gonna be like "Oh my god!"

- In movies there are
scenes of like powerful men,

like shaving.
- Yeah.

- Which is funny, you don't
see powerful women in movies,

like making plans while
they like shave their legs.
- [Quinta] Well maybe we should.
- [Becky] (laughing) Maybe we should.
- [Quinta] Yeah.

title: Girls Shave Their Faces For The First Time

comments.text:
I don't think people understand that it depends on the coarseness of your 
hair and how your skin is. Some women have to remove the hair from their 
face through shaving, threading, etc. Like my face for example has always 
had hair growth on it. Like I had to shave cause no one told me what to do 
with it. There are no instructions when it comes to facial hair and women. 
I shave when I have to and I get no bad things. Yes, it seems to grow back 
quicker and thicker but it really doesn't. I think is overall pretty nice. 
My face is soft and shiny. It just seriously depends how your skin and hair 
is.﻿
comments.author: Becca Ash

comments.text:
Shaving is actually a really bad idea. It makes your hair more noticeable. 
I once shaved my legs for fun and now it's growing back more thicker and

comments.author: Charity Peter

comments.text:
+123itstime4tea It's a myth.  The hair does not come back darker.  Your 
hair before it is cut, is pointed and sometimes split, making it appear 
fine.  When you chop the end off it creates a blunt end, which over time, 
will return back to its pointed and split end.  

I recently had surgery on my wrist and my femur.  My leg was shaved, as 
well as my wrist.  My wrist was covered for 8 weeks in a cast, and my leg 
remained uncovered.  My wrist came out noticeably darker, because it was 
covered for 8 weeks.  Lack of light tends to do that to hair.  My thigh, 
being uncovered, came back looking exactly like the other side.  Not 
thicker, not darker.
comments.author: hondac55

comments.text:
+hondac55 Actually it does. It doesn't come back thicker, but instead 
darker. Many people have already experienced it, including me.
comments.author: 123itstime4tea

comments.text:
+Charity Peter That's a myth. Cutting hair has no effect on its darkness, 
thickness, or overall noticeability.

ROTFLMAO!

It takes me four razors to shave everything.  I can only use them once.

comments.author: Brenna Bliss

comments.text:
+HarmlessCritterz sorry England has such extreme shaving prices. It's not

comments.author: Yas Mean

comments.text:
+Brenna Bliss Cheaper?? Haha you are clearly deluded. Where i live a pack 
of 8 razor blades is £20 (approx US$40) and a can of nice shaving gel comes 
to around £3 (US$6). Don't forget the aftershave which costs £6 (US$12). 
That is £29 (US$58) in total. If you shave everyday (which most men 
eventually do) a pack of 8 razors will go in about 5-6 weeks. Which means 
for the year, razor blades alone cost about £200 not including all the 
extras. Male razors have to be better because we are shaving our faces not 
our legs. Faces are sensitive. By the way, i occasionally shave my legs for 
swimming competitions so i have had it worse than any girl. Try spending 2 
hours in the shower shaving male leg hair with a little razor- if i can do 
that, you cant complain about your easy shaving tasks.
comments.author: HarmlessCritterz

comments.author: twightlight3

comments.text:
I KNOW this wasn't the intent of anyone that was involved filming this, but 
as a woman with PSOS, this actually kind of hurt me to watch. The only one 
that seemed to actually GET it was Gaby (who has consistently been my 
favorite throughout as I almost always relate well to her), the other women 
were laughing it off and talking about how great it feels to do and how 
silky their skin felt afterward. I just wish they talked more about the 
stigma that women with hirsutism have to deal with shaving their face every 
day (sometimes multiple times per day) instead of "La la la this feels 
funny omg my skin feels so smooth now i would totes do it again". A lot of 
women feel hopeless and trapped because of hirsutism. Damned if we do, 
damned if we don't.﻿

comments.author: Isabelle Nesheva

comments.text:
A lot of people are saying its a myth but I've asked lots of people about 
my situation and they never have an answer. When I was younger I was stupid 
and decided to shave my lower back and my stomach. Within weeks dark hair 
grew back and my hair was blonde. People told me it was puberty and bound 
to happen anyways. Thing is, on my stomach I only shaved one little part, 
and that little part is the only area where darker hair grew back. 
Everywhere around that area is blonde still. Literally it's like a shave 
mark of darker hair and it's a constant reminder that kids are stupid and 
I'm constantly having to pluck that area. It also seems like the more I 
pluck it the more hair grows back. Ugh!!﻿
comments.author: Olivia Colin

comments.text:
Its not okay to SHAVE your face as a girl. .the facial hair will grow 
thicker and faster and the skin will be just like a man's. For girls are 
the hot depilation strips which let your skin smooth and pretty.The "Bic 
effect" is just on the moment, the next day your face will be rough ...you 
better choose a twizzer to a Bic (even tho depilation strips are the best 
and'll always be) But thats not even necessarly (no matter the way) if its 
ONLY fluff...if your brunette, yes , you have to.( "You have to" is too 
much said...you "should" sounds better;) :) ) So yeah .. shaving the facial 
hair is the biggest mistake a girl could ever make (ofc there are 
exceptions like those with hormonal problems or those girls with beards-for 
those its perfect and its not a shame, we dont choose the way we born...) 
so mmyep , just my opinion , iam not hating on anyone, just saying... :) 
p.s: If u think Im wrong comment or dislike or whatev only do not swear, 
just say it in a pretty way.^^﻿
